ssl.name: SSL/TLS
opt: openssl 1.1.1 is one of the more performant versions
If not using certain functionality boringssl can give better performance
modern CPU architectures have more SIMD (single instruction multiple data) execution units and can often execute the cryptographic parts of networking much faster

libc.name: glibc standard c library
opt: You could be doing unecessary data copying. Pass data by reference when possible to prevent copies
You could have lots of syscalls. Try batching any syscalls or look for optimized IO options like XDP (express data path) or io_uring for networking. Also some reads and writes can be batched.

redis-server.name: Redis
opt: Redis 6 added threads for IO which can offload some work from the otherwise single threaded tool.

\/org\/apache\/spark.name: Spark
opt: Try using a modern execution engine like velox

\/org\/apache\/cassandra.name: Cassandra
opt: Premium optimizations

mongo.name: Mongodb
opt: Verify that your indexes are being used with profile()
Upgrade to v8 for performance

nginx.name: nginx
opt: Ensure you are using an optimized SSL/TLS
See server health check section for network tunables

java.name: Java
opt: openjdk 16+ has the vector api which enables more use of the SIMD api.
Some of corretto's compression libraries are faster than openjdk's

envoy.name: Envoy
opt: Premium optimizations

kafka.name: Kafka
opt: Premium optimizations

tensorflow.name: TensorFlow
opt: Try quantizing your weights to better utilize underlying CPU execution units. Some companies offer tools for converting your models like Intel's neural compressor and oneDNN

(deflate|inflate).name: Deflate/Inflate compression
opt: most compression benefits from newer CPUs and versions compiled to utilize advanced instruction sets

snappy.name: Snappy
opt: Snappy is more performant when compiled with clang instead of GCC
Optimized to use SIMD instructions on modern CPU architectures, try upgrading to a newer CPU

zstd.name: Z Standard
opt: Can be offloaded with Intel's QAT which is on Sapphire rapids or later architectures
Optimized to use SIMD instructions on modern CPU architectures, try upgrading to a newer CPU

prometheus.name: Prometheus
opt: Try reducing the scrape_interval to limit overhead

alloc.name: Allocators
opt: TCmalloc can be used to improve performance on multithreaded allocation workloads by maintaining a per-cpu cache and zoning to prevent fragmentation

GC.name: Garbage Collection
opt: Using parallel garbage collection reduces overhead

swapper.name: swapper
opt: server is either under utilized or idling on IO. Either downsize or add more work
